alert.note: Alert for McIntosh; Okfuskee; Okmulgee (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 15 at 5:28PM CDT until May 15 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN MCINTOSH...SOUTHWESTERN OKMULGEE AND EASTERN OKFUSKEE COUNTIES... At 528 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles south of Okemah, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Tennis ball size hail and 70 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Broadcast media. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations in or near the path include... Okemah... Weleetka... Hanna... Bearden... Castle... Clearview... Pharoah... Bryant... Vernon... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 213 and 235. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare immediately for large hail and damaging winds. People outside should move to a shelter, inside a strong building and away from windows.
